title.title: Residual or Essential
On the Problem of Overlap as Argument to Broaden the Solution Space of Markup

author.affiliation: Akademie der Wissenschaften und der Literatur. Mainz, Germany.
Huygens Institute for the History of the Netherlands â€“ Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences. Amsterdam, The Netherlands.

sourceDesc.p: Converted from an OASIS Open Document

keywords.term: text encoding and markup language creation, deployment, and analysis

body.p: We return to the problem of overlap in embedded markup. We argue that the addressing of overlap as a merely technical issue signals a myopic view in the field of digital textual scholarship. Overlap is not a residual problem in an otherwise evolved and exclusive solution to text modeling. Instead, the problem of overlap indicates that digital text should be approached scholarly by application of multple modeling paradigms. To further suport our argument we present how the SPEEDy standoff properties editor succeeds in combining different markup ontologies productively.
